resources.string: An accelerometer sensor reports the acceleration of the device along the 3 sensor axes. The measured acceleration includes both the physical acceleration (change of velocity) and the gravity.

A magnetic field sensor (also known as magnetometer) reports the ambient magnetic field, as measured along the 3 sensor axes. The measurement is reported in the x, y and z Axis and all values are in micro-Tesla (µT).
A three dimensional vector indicating the direction and magnitude of gravity. Units are m/s².
A gyroscope sensor reports the rate of rotation of the device around the 3 sensor axes. Units are rad/sec (Radian per second)
A three dimensional vector indicating acceleration along each device axis, not including gravity. Units are m/s².
This sensor reports the ambient (room) temperature in degrees Celsius.
A light sensor reports the current illumination in lux.

string.name: infoPressure
string.br: A pressure sensor (also known as barometer) reports the atmospheric pressure in hectopascal (hPa).
The barometer is often used to estimate elevation changes.

resources.string: A relative humidity sensor measures relative ambient air humidity and reports the value in percent.
The rotation vector represents the orientation of the device as a combination of an angle and an axis. Elements of the rotation vector are unitless.

string.name: infoProximity
string.br: A proximity sensor reports the distance from the sensor to the closest visible surface.
Note that some proximity sensors only support a binary "near" or "far" measurement.

resources.string: A sensor of this type reports the number of steps taken by the user since the last reboot while activated. The value is reset to zero only on a system reboot.
